title: Linux lprm Command with Practical Examples
description: Explore the Linux lprm command for removing print jobs, including how to remove a specific job or all jobs. Learn practical examples to manage your print queue effectively.

meta.title: Linux lprm Command with Practical Examples
meta.description: Explore the Linux lprm command for removing print jobs, including how to remove a specific job or all jobs. Learn practical examples to manage your print queue effectively.
meta.keywords: Linux, lprm, print job, remove, queue, command, examples

verify.name: Verify the lprm command removes a specific print job
verify.hint: The lprm command did not successfully remove the print job with ID 1. Please try the command again.

verify.name: Verify the lprm command removes all print jobs
verify.hint: The lprm command did not successfully remove all print jobs from the queue. Please try the command again.

verify.name: Verify the lprm command removes a specific print job
verify.hint: The lprm command did not successfully remove the print job with ID 2. Please try the command again.

verify.name: Verify the print queue no longer contains the removed job
verify.hint: The print queue still contains the print job with ID 2, which should have been removed. Please check the output of the lpq command.

verify.name: Verify the lprm command removes all print jobs
verify.hint: The lprm command did not successfully remove all print jobs from the queue. Please try the command again.

verify.name: Verify the print queue is empty
verify.hint: The print queue still contains entries, which means not all print jobs were removed. Please check the output of the lpq command.
